Class Heater

java.lang.Object
  Heater

public class Heater
extends java.lang.Object

Heater simply represents a heater. It stores a temperature which can be manipulated by calling cooler or warmer, functions within the class.

Constructor Summary
Heater(int setMin, int setMax)
          Constructs a Heater.
 
Method Summary
 void cooler()
          Decreases temperature by increment.
 int getTemperature()
          Returns the Heater's current temperature.
 void setIncrement(int newIncrement)
          Sets a new temperature increment.
 void warmer()
          Increases temperature by increment.
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Constructor Detail

Heater

public Heater(int setMin,
              int setMax)
Constructs a Heater. Heater defaults to a temperature of 15 degrees and sets to increment by 5. setMin and setMax are used to limit the temperature range of the Heater.

Parameters:
setMin - Minimal temperature that can be produced. Should be less than the default temperature.
setMax - Maximal temperature that can be produced. Should be more than the default temperature.
Method Detail

getTemperature

public int getTemperature()
Returns the Heater's current temperature.

warmer

public void warmer()
Increases temperature by increment. Limits the temperature to max.

cooler

public void cooler()
Decreases temperature by increment. Limits the temperature to min.

setIncrement

public void setIncrement(int newIncrement)
Sets a new temperature increment. Used to determine the steps between temperature used by cooler and warmer.

Parameters:
newIncrement - New increment value to be used.
